episodes.title: Ep 66 AA's Secret Cult Religion Origins – Part 3 of 4
episodes.description: How Bill W was coerced into a cult.. Bill W was drugged on Belladonna in an alcohol rehab center when he was coerced into a cult religion. For a year prior to that, Bill Wilson was aggressively recruited into the Oxford Group — a fundamentalist cult religion — by his friend Ebby then he became its proselytizer. What we were taught about the “birth of AA” is a false narrative. Timestamps: 00:00 AA cult religion origins intro 02:00 Ebby's coerced conversion 02:48 Ebby coerces Bill's conversion 06:58 Generational recovery trauma 08:46 Bill starts deceptively proselytizing 11:48 Spiritual experience or coerced conversion? Want guidance in your deconstructing AA process? If so, you can check out my Deprogramming AA course here: 🌀 Deprogram AA Course 🛒 Browse All Courses 💬 Let’s Connect @SobrietyBestie DM me or comment on any Sobriety Bestie socials. I’m here for the conversation. Let’s get f*cking free.

episodes.title: Ep 65 AA's Secret Cult Religion Origins – Part 2 of 4
episodes.description: Today we’re going deep into the cult that birthed Alcoholics Anonymous: The Oxford Group. AA didn’t start as an independent program — it was copied almost point-for-point from a religious cult with authoritarian, even fascist-tinged, ideology. 00:00 AA cult religion DNA intro 01:02 Oxford Group + Alcoholics Anonymous 04:03 AA copied Oxford Group core practices 06:14 Social control + structure 08:58 Psychological control techniques 10:05 Authoritarianism + fascist Once you see the DNA of where AA really came from — you can start to truly deconstruct its hold on your mind. Want guidance in your deconstructing AA process? If so, you can check out my Deprogramming AA course here: 🌀 Deprogram AA Course 🛒 Browse All Courses 💬 Let’s Connect @SobrietyBestie DM me or comment on any Sobriety Bestie socials. I’m here for the conversation. Let’s get f*cking free.

episodes.title: Ep 64 AA's Secret Cult Religion Origins – Part 1 of 4
episodes.description: Why does Alcoholics Anonymous STILL hide its origin? In this first episode of the AA Cult Religion DNA series, we’re diving deep into the mythology vs. reality of how AA really began — and why the truth has been covered up for nearly 100 years. Was it really founded in 1935? Why are the Oxford Group cult religion roots missing from AA’s official story? And what does this deceptive recruiting mean for those of us who trusted AA? Want guidance in your deconstructing AA process? If so, you can check out my Deprogramming AA course here: 🌀 Deprogram AA Course 🛒 Browse All Courses 💬 Let’s Connect @SobrietyBestie DM me or comment on any Sobriety Bestie socials. I’m here for the conversation. Let’s get f*cking free.

episodes.title: Ep 63 Debunking the "AA Saves Millions" Myth #CultyComments
episodes.description:
In today’s Culty Comments episode, we’re breaking down a classic fear-based Alcoholics Anonymous defense: “AA saves millions — your message could kill people!”

Is it "badmouthing" to talk about the actual harms of a system? Or… is the system the one doing harm? 🤔

We’ll unpack:
✅ The myth of “millions saved” (with no data to back it)
✅ How AA defenders use emotional blackmail to silence dissent
✅ Why questioning the system is NOT the same as harming people
✅ How coercive control works in AA ideology

We are waking up to cult tactics in 2025. Talking about harm is not harm — it’s healing. Let’s get free.

episodes.title: Yes, Alcoholics Anonymous Is A Cult – Part 2 of 4
episodes.description:
YES, AA is a cult. This is art 2 of a 4-part series comparing Alcoholics Anonymous to the “Characteristics Associated with Cultic Groups” by Michael D. Langone, Ph.D. (International Cultic Studies Association).

In this episode, we'll cover checklist points 5–8 with how they can show up inside Alcoholics Anonymous.

If you’ve ever heard “don’t trust your thinking,” or “outside help won’t work,” you’ve lived this.

Timestamps:
00:00 AA is a cult intro
01:13 5 – The group is elitist
06:28 6 – Us-versus-them mentality
12:45 7 – Leaders are not accountable
18:12 8 – Ends justify the means mentality

episodes.title: 8 Signs AA Is Controlling Your Mind – Part 4 of 8: Cult of Confession
episodes.description:
and how AA uses this tactic to break you down and keep you dependent..

We explore how Alcoholics Anonymous normalizes emotional exposure to unqualified sponsors, reframes trauma as your fault, and builds a culture where silence is seen as dangerous, boundaries are seen as defects, and outside help is often discouraged — sometimes with tragic consequences.

Is this “spiritual progress,” or psychological control?

Let’s talk about confession culture, coercive sponsorship, and what it really means to reclaim your autonomy.

Leave your thoughts in the comments — this episode needs a conversation.

It's safe to trust yourself.

episodes.title: AA’s Harm Runs Deeper Than You Think
episodes.description:
AA is worse than I thought — 5 weeks of speaking out is changing everything.

I was in AA for 10 years — from 2009 to 2020. I left five years ago. But it wasn’t until I started talking about it publicly that I realized how deep the indoctrination really went.

Now that I’m five weeks into sharing my truth online, I’m seeing AA with new eyes — and honestly, it’s worse than I thought. 

The control, the shame, the silencing… it’s all showing up again, only this time I’m on the outside of Alcoholics Anonymous.

episodes.title: Ep 35 Finding A Good Therapist After AA
episodes.description: When you're deprogramming from Alcoholics Anonymous or any high-control group, finding the right therapist can make all the difference. In this episode of the Sobriety Bestie Podcast, I walk you through key questions to ask when choosing a therapist — based on advice from cult recovery expert Dr. Janja Lalich. This isn’t just about credentials. It’s about alignment, safety, and whether your therapist truly supports your freedom — not just your compliance. episodes.title: Ep 25 Is Alcoholics Anonymous a Cult?
episodes.description: The question so many of us wonder... Is Alcoholics Anonymous a Cult? We're pulling today's pod from Sobriety Bestie YouTube on.. is AA a cult. Listen in here or you can watch it on Sobriety Bestie Youtube. Based on my 10 years inside AA, 5 years outside AA, and everything I’ve learned since speaking publicly — I’m unpacking it all. Inside this episode: ✨ My first impressions of AA (hint: it wasn’t great) ✨ Love bombing, mind control, and "friends with conditions" ✨ Why informed consent matters in recovery ✨ How the real whiplash hit AFTER I left ✨ Why speaking out is met with cult-like behavior ✨ And how my mind is still evolving on this question today This is about truth. freedom. critical thinking. If you’ve ever wondered: – "What the hell did I just go through?" – "Why does leaving AA feel so intense?" – "Am I crazy for questioning it?" You are not alone. There are thousands of us silently thriving after leaving AA.
